/-!
# String Uppercase Conversion

Converts all lowercase letters in a string to uppercase while preserving non-alphabetic characters.

Edge cases:
- Empty string returns empty string
- Non-alphabetic characters remain unchanged
-/

namespace StringUppercase

/--
Converts a String to uppercase.
Returns the input string with all lowercase letters converted to uppercase.
Non-alphabetic characters are preserved unchanged.

Examples:
>>> toUppercase "hello" = "HELLO"
>>> toUppercase "" = ""
>>> toUppercase "Hello123!" = "HELLO123!"
-/
def toUppercase (s : String) : String :=
  s.map (fun c => if c.isLower then c.toUpper else c)

/-! Unit Tests -/

-- Basic tests
#eval toUppercase "hello" -- Expected: "HELLO"
#eval toUppercase "Hello World" -- Expected: "HELLO WORLD"

-- Edge case tests
#eval toUppercase "" -- Expected: ""
#eval toUppercase "123" -- Expected: "123"
#eval toUppercase "Hello123!" -- Expected: "HELLO123!"
#eval toUppercase "ALREADY_UPPER" -- Expected: "ALREADY_UPPER"
#eval toUppercase "!@#$%" -- Expected: "!@#$%"

-- Example proofs
example : toUppercase "hello" = "HELLO" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase "" = "" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase "123" = "123" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase "HELLO" = "HELLO" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase "Hello World" = "HELLO WORLD" := by native_decide

/-! Properties and Theorems -/

/-- Empty string property -/
theorem empty_string_thm : toUppercase "" = "" := by native_decide

/-- Idempotency: applying uppercase twice is same as once -/
theorem idempotent (s : String) : 
  toUppercase (toUppercase s) = toUppercase s := sorry

/-- Already uppercase strings remain unchanged -/
theorem uppercase_unchanged (s : String) : 
  s.data.all Char.isUpper → toUppercase s = s := sorry

/-- Non-alphabetic characters remain unchanged -/
theorem preserves_nonalpha (s : String) :
  s.data.all (fun c => !c.isAlpha) → toUppercase s = s := sorry

/-- Length preservation property -/
theorem length_preserved (s : String) :
  (toUppercase s).length = s.length := sorry

/-! Additional Properties -/

/-- Single character case: lowercase to uppercase -/
theorem single_char_lower (c : Char) :
  c.isLower → toUppercase c.toString = c.toUpper.toString := sorry

/-- Single character case: uppercase remains unchanged -/
theorem single_char_upper (c : Char) :
  c.isUpper → toUppercase c.toString = c.toString := sorry

/-- Single character case: non-alpha remains unchanged -/
theorem single_char_nonalpha (c : Char) :
  !c.isAlpha → toUppercase c.toString = c.toString := sorry

/-- Concatenation property -/
theorem concat_property (s₁ s₂ : String) :
  toUppercase (s₁ ++ s₂) = toUppercase s₁ ++ toUppercase s₂ := sorry

/-! Additional Test Cases -/

-- Mixed content tests
#eval toUppercase "Hello@World123" -- Expected: "HELLO@WORLD123"
#eval toUppercase "abc123DEF!@#" -- Expected: "ABC123DEF!@#"
#eval toUppercase "   spaces   " -- Expected: "   SPACES   "

-- Property-based test examples
example : toUppercase "abc" ++ toUppercase "def" = toUppercase "abcdef" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase (toUppercase "Hello") = toUppercase "Hello" := by native_decide
example : (toUppercase "Hello").length = "Hello".length := by native_decide

end StringUppercase

/-!
# String Uppercase Conversion

Converts all lowercase letters in a string to uppercase.

Edge cases:
- Empty string returns empty string 
- Non-alphabetic characters remain unchanged
-/

namespace StringUppercase

/--
Converts a string to uppercase by converting all lowercase letters to uppercase.
Non-alphabetic characters remain unchanged.
-/
def toUpper (s : String) : String :=
  let chars := s.data.map fun c =>
    if c.isLower then 
      c.toUpper
    else
      c
  String.mk chars

/-! Unit Tests -/

-- Basic test
#eval toUpper "hello" -- Expected: "HELLO"

-- Edge case: empty string
#eval toUpper "" -- Expected: ""

-- Mixed case with numbers and symbols
#eval toUpper "Hello123!@#" -- Expected: "HELLO123!@#"

-- Already uppercase
#eval toUpper "WORLD" -- Expected: "WORLD"

-- Non-alphabetic characters
#eval toUpper "123!@#" -- Expected: "123!@#"

/-! Examples and Properties -/

-- Basic conversion test
example : toUpper "hello" = "HELLO" := by native_decide

-- Empty string test
example : toUpper "" = "" := by native_decide

-- Mixed case test
example : toUpper "Hello123" = "HELLO123" := by native_decide

-- Already uppercase test
example : toUpper "WORLD" = "WORLD" := by native_decide

/-! Properties -/

/-- Idempotency: converting to uppercase twice gives same result as once -/
theorem toUpper_idempotent (s : String) : 
  toUpper (toUpper s) = toUpper s := sorry

/-- Empty string property -/
theorem toUpper_empty : toUpper "" = "" := by native_decide

end StringUppercase

example : toUppercase "abc" ++ toUppercase "def" = toUppercase "abcdef" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase (toUppercase "Hello") = toUppercase "Hello" := by native_decide
example : (toUppercase "Hello").length = "Hello".length := by native_decide

end StringUppercase

/-!
# String Uppercase Conversion

Converts all lowercase letters in a string to uppercase while preserving non-alphabetic characters.

Edge cases:
- Empty string returns empty string
- Non-alphabetic characters remain unchanged
-/

namespace StringUppercase

/--
Converts a String to uppercase.
Returns the input string with all lowercase letters converted to uppercase.
Non-alphabetic characters are preserved unchanged.

Examples:
>>> toUppercase "hello" = "HELLO"
>>> toUppercase "" = ""
>>> toUppercase "Hello123!" = "HELLO123!"
-/
def toUppercase (s : String) : String :=
  s.map (fun c => if c.isLower then c.toUpper else c)

/-! Unit Tests -/

-- Basic tests
#eval toUppercase "hello" -- Expected: "HELLO"
#eval toUppercase "Hello World" -- Expected: "HELLO WORLD"

-- Edge case tests
#eval toUppercase "" -- Expected: ""
#eval toUppercase "123" -- Expected: "123"
#eval toUppercase "Hello123!" -- Expected: "HELLO123!"
#eval toUppercase "ALREADY_UPPER" -- Expected: "ALREADY_UPPER"
#eval toUppercase "!@#$%" -- Expected: "!@#$%"

-- Example proofs
example : toUppercase "hello" = "HELLO" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase "" = "" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase "123" = "123" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase "HELLO" = "HELLO" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase "Hello World" = "HELLO WORLD" := by native_decide

/-! Properties and Theorems -/

/-- Empty string property -/
theorem empty_string_thm : toUppercase "" = "" := by native_decide

/-- Idempotency: applying uppercase twice is same as once -/
theorem idempotent (s : String) : 
  toUppercase (toUppercase s) = toUppercase s := sorry

/-- Already uppercase strings remain unchanged -/
theorem uppercase_unchanged (s : String) : 
  s.data.all Char.isUpper → toUppercase s = s := sorry

/-- Non-alphabetic characters remain unchanged -/
theorem preserves_nonalpha (s : String) :
  s.data.all (fun c => !c.isAlpha) → toUppercase s = s := sorry

/-- Length preservation property -/
theorem length_preserved (s : String) :
  (toUppercase s).length = s.length := sorry

/-! Additional Properties -/

/-- Single character case: lowercase to uppercase -/
theorem single_char_lower (c : Char) :
  c.isLower → toUppercase c.toString = c.toUpper.toString := sorry

/-- Single character case: uppercase remains unchanged -/
theorem single_char_upper (c : Char) :
  c.isUpper → toUppercase c.toString = c.toString := sorry

/-- Single character case: non-alpha remains unchanged -/
theorem single_char_nonalpha (c : Char) :
  !c.isAlpha → toUppercase c.toString = c.toString := sorry

/-- Concatenation property -/
theorem concat_property (s₁ s₂ : String) :
  toUppercase (s₁ ++ s₂) = toUppercase s₁ ++ toUppercase s₂ := sorry

/-! Additional Test Cases -/

-- Mixed content tests
#eval toUppercase "Hello@World123" -- Expected: "HELLO@WORLD123"
#eval toUppercase "abc123DEF!@#" -- Expected: "ABC123DEF!@#"
#eval toUppercase "   spaces   " -- Expected: "   SPACES   "

-- Property-based test examples
example : toUppercase "abc" ++ toUppercase "def" = toUppercase "abcdef" := by native_decide
example : toUppercase (toUppercase "Hello") = toUppercase "Hello" := by native_decide
example : (toUppercase "Hello").length = "Hello".length := by native_decide

end StringUppercase
